Constructor detail
MediaRequest()constructor
public function MediaRequest(readToken:String, serialize:Boolean = true, apiPath:String = "http://api.brightcove.com/services/library")

Class constructor

Parameters
readToken:String — the Brightcove Media API read token
 
serialize:Boolean (default = true) — an optional URL for invoking the media requests, the default is the published media API path: 'http://api.brightcove.com/services/library'
 
apiPath:String (default = "http://api.brightcove.com/services/library") — If set to true, then the result data should be serialized from generic JSON into strongly typed ActionScript objects
Method detail
executeRequest()method
public function executeRequest(extendedParameters:String, requestType:MediaRequestType, requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean = true):String

Execute the Brightcove Media API asynchronous request for the token based upon the given Media Request type. If a result has been returned, populate this object with the result converted into native AS3 objects, not JSON, and dispatch an event notifing listeners of this object that the request has been completed. If a fault has been returned, store the fault in this object and dispatch a Fault event notifying listeners that a fault has occured.

Parameters
extendedParameters:String — extendedParameters Query arguments to be added to the path of the Media API request
 
requestType:MediaRequestType — requestType The type of request being executed, for example "Load All Videos"
 
requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean (default = true) — requestShouldBeExecuted If set to true, then contstruct and execute the request otherwise just construct and return the request URL

Returns
String — the request URL
findAllVideos()method 
public function findAllVideos(pageSize:Number = 100, pageNumber:Number = 0, sortBy:SortByTypeEnum = null, sortOrder:SortOrderTypeEnum = null, getItemCount:Boolean = false, fieldList:Array = null, customFields:Array = null, mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum = null, output:OutputTypeEnum = null, allVideoFields:Boolean = false, requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean = true):String

Find all videos in the Brightcove media library for this account. This method has the limitation of returning only videos available for play, and does not include videos marked as inactive, currently in the upload process, or outside the scheduled play time. See Searching for Unavailable Videos with the Media API for information about solutions to these limitations.

Parameters
pageSize:Number (default = 100) — Number of items returned per page.
 
pageNumber:Number (default = 0) — The zero-indexed number of the page to return.
 
sortBy:SortByTypeEnum (default = null) — The field by which to sort the results. A SortByType: One of PUBLISH_DATE, CREATION_DATE, MODIFIED_DATE, PLAYS_TOTAL, PLAYS_TRAILING_WEEK.
 
sortOrder:SortOrderTypeEnum (default = null) — How to order the results: ascending (ASC) or descending (DESC).
 
getItemCount:Boolean (default = false) — If true, also return how many total results there are.
 
fieldList:Array (default = null) — A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publishedDate , lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.
 
customFields:Array (default = null) — A comma-separated list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value customFields in the video_fields parameter.
 
mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum (default = null) — This is a MediaDeliveryTypeEnum with a value of http, http_ios or default. It is meaningful only if used together with the video_fields=FLVURL, videoFullLength, or renditions parameters. If universal delivery service is enabled for your account, set this optional parameter to http to return video by HTTP, rather than streaming. For Apple HTTP Live Streaming videos, set this optional parameter to http_ios to return the HTTP URL of the master index file as the videoFullLength parameter. For more information, see Delivering Videos with Apple HTTP Live Streaming.
 
output:OutputTypeEnum (default = null) — The default output is JSON, but you can get the output in XML, using RSS or MRSS. Use the output argument with the read methods to specify the format of the output. Valid values of the output argument are: json (the default), mrss (RSS with Media RSS and Brightcove extensions), and tm (for distribution through TubeMogul OneLoad). See RSS Output from the Media API and Creating Feeds for TubeMogul OneLoad with the Media API for code examples.
 
allVideoFields:Boolean (default = false) — If set to true, all available Video Fields will be included false otherwise
 
requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean (default = true) — If true (default), then execute this request, otherwise just return the request URL.

Returns
String — The request URL to the Brightcove Media APIs
findModifiedVideos()method 
public function findModifiedVideos(fromDate:Date, filter:Array = null, pageSize:Number = 100, pageNumber:Number = 0, sortBy:SortByTypeEnum = null, sortOrder:SortOrderTypeEnum = null, getItemCount:Boolean = false, videoFields:Array = null, customFields:Array = null, mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum = null, output:OutputTypeEnum = null, allVideoFields:Boolean = false, requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean = true):String

Gets all the videos that have been modified since the given time.

Parameters
fromDate:Date — The date of the oldest Video which you would like returned.
 
filter:Array (default = null) — A list of FilterTypeEnums, specifying which categories of videos you would like returned. Valid filter values are PLAYABLE, UNSCHEDULED, INACTIVE, and DELETED.
 
pageSize:Number (default = 100) — Number of items returned per page.
 
pageNumber:Number (default = 0) — The zero-indexed number of the page to return.
 
sortBy:SortByTypeEnum (default = null) — The field by which to sort the results. A SortByType: One of PUBLISH_DATE, CREATION_DATE, MODIFIED_DATE, PLAYS_TOTAL, PLAYS_TRAILING_WEEK.
 
sortOrder:SortOrderTypeEnum (default = null) — How to order the results: ascending (ASC) or descending (DESC).
 
getItemCount:Boolean (default = false) — If true, also return how many total results there are.
 
videoFields:Array (default = null) — A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publishedDate , lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.
 
customFields:Array (default = null) — A comma-separated list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value customFields in the video_fields parameter.
 
mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum (default = null) — This is a MediaDeliveryTypeEnum with a value of http, http_ios or default. It is meaningful only if used together with the video_fields=FLVURL, videoFullLength, or renditions parameters. If universal delivery service is enabled for your account, set this optional parameter to http to return video by HTTP, rather than streaming. For Apple HTTP Live Streaming videos, set this optional parameter to http_ios to return the HTTP URL of the master index file as the videoFullLength parameter. For more information, see Delivering Videos with Apple HTTP Live Streaming.
 
output:OutputTypeEnum (default = null) — The default output is JSON, but you can get the output in XML, using RSS or MRSS. Use the output argument with the read methods to specify the format of the output. Valid values of the output argument are: json (the default), mrss (RSS with Media RSS and Brightcove extensions), and tm (for distribution through TubeMogul OneLoad). See RSS Output from the Media API and Creating Feeds for TubeMogul OneLoad with the Media API for code examples.
 
allVideoFields:Boolean (default = false) — If set to true, all available Video Fields will be included false otherwise
 
requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean (default = true) — If true (default), then execute this request, otherwise just return the request URL.

Returns
String — The request URL to the Brightcove Media APIs
findRelatedVideos()method 
public function findRelatedVideos(videoId:Number = -1, referenceId:String = "", pageSize:Number = 100, pageNumber:Number = 0, getItemCount:Boolean = false, videoFields:Array = null, customFields:Array = null, mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum = null, output:OutputTypeEnum = null, allVideoFields:Boolean = false, requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean = true):String

Finds videos related to the given video. Combines the name and short description of the given video and searches for any partial matches in the name, short description, long description, tags, and custom fields of all videos in the Brightcove media library for this account. More precise ways of finding related videos include tagging your videos by subject and using the find_videos_by_tags method to find videos that share the same tags: or creating a playlist that includes videos that you know are related. Consider using the search_videos method, which offers more flexible search and sorting options.

Parameters
videoId:Number (default = -1) — The ID of the video you would like to retrieve.
 
referenceId:String (default = "") — The publisher-assigned reference ID of the video we'd like related videos for.
 
pageSize:Number (default = 100) — Number of items returned per page.
 
pageNumber:Number (default = 0) — The zero-indexed number of the page to return.
 
getItemCount:Boolean (default = false) — If true, also return how many total results there are.
 
videoFields:Array (default = null) — A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publishedDate , lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.
 
customFields:Array (default = null) — A comma-separated list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value customFields in the video_fields parameter.
 
mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum (default = null) — This is a MediaDeliveryTypeEnum with a value of http, http_ios or default. It is meaningful only if used together with the video_fields=FLVURL, videoFullLength, or renditions parameters. If universal delivery service is enabled for your account, set this optional parameter to http to return video by HTTP, rather than streaming. For Apple HTTP Live Streaming videos, set this optional parameter to http_ios to return the HTTP URL of the master index file as the videoFullLength parameter. For more information, see Delivering Videos with Apple HTTP Live Streaming.
 
output:OutputTypeEnum (default = null) — The default output is JSON, but you can get the output in XML, using RSS or MRSS. Use the output argument with the read methods to specify the format of the output. Valid values of the output argument are: json (the default), mrss (RSS with Media RSS and Brightcove extensions), and tm (for distribution through TubeMogul OneLoad). See RSS Output from the Media API and Creating Feeds for TubeMogul OneLoad with the Media API for code examples.
 
allVideoFields:Boolean (default = false) — If set to true, all available Video Fields will be included false otherwise
 
requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean (default = true) — If true (default), then execute this request, otherwise just return the request URL.

Returns
String — The request URL to the Brightcove Media APIs
findVideoById()method 
public function findVideoById(videoId:Number, videoFields:Array = null, customFields:Array = null, mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum = null, output:OutputTypeEnum = null, isFiltered:Boolean = true, allVideoFields:Boolean = false, requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean = true):String

Finds a single video with the specified ID. See Accessing Video Content with the Media API for various examples of the find_video_by_id method.

Parameters
videoId:Number — The ID of the video you would like to retrieve.
 
videoFields:Array (default = null) — A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publishedDate , lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.
 
customFields:Array (default = null) — A comma-separated list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value customFields in the video_fields parameter.
 
mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum (default = null) — This is a MediaDeliveryTypeEnum with a value of http, http_ios or default. It is meaningful only if used together with the video_fields=FLVURL, videoFullLength, or renditions parameters. If universal delivery service is enabled for your account, set this optional parameter to http to return video by HTTP, rather than streaming. For Apple HTTP Live Streaming videos, set this optional parameter to http_ios to return the HTTP URL of the master index file as the videoFullLength parameter. For more information, see Delivering Videos with Apple HTTP Live Streaming.
 
output:OutputTypeEnum (default = null) — The default output is JSON, but you can get the output in XML, using RSS or MRSS. Use the output argument with the read methods to specify the format of the output. Valid values of the output argument are: json (the default), mrss (RSS with Media RSS and Brightcove extensions), and tm (for distribution through TubeMogul OneLoad). See RSS Output from the Media API and Creating Feeds for TubeMogul OneLoad with the Media API for code examples.
 
isFiltered:Boolean (default = true) — If set to false, the 'unfiltered' version of this method will be called, it also returns videos that are unscheduled, inactive, or deleted
 
allVideoFields:Boolean (default = false) — If set to true, all available Video Fields will be included false otherwise
 
requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean (default = true) — If true (default), then execute this request, otherwise just return the request URL.

Returns
String — The request URL to the Brightcove Media APIs
findVideoByReferenceId()method 
public function findVideoByReferenceId(referenceId:String, videoFields:Array = null, customFields:Array = null, mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum = null, output:OutputTypeEnum = null, isFiltered:Boolean = true, allVideoFields:Boolean = false, requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean = true):String

Find a video based on its publisher-assigned reference ID.

Parameters
referenceId:String — The publisher-assigned reference ID for the video we're searching for.
 
videoFields:Array (default = null) — A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publishedDate , lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.
 
customFields:Array (default = null) — A comma-separated list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value customFields in the video_fields parameter.
 
mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum (default = null) — This is a MediaDeliveryTypeEnum with a value of http, http_ios or default. It is meaningful only if used together with the video_fields=FLVURL, videoFullLength, or renditions parameters. If universal delivery service is enabled for your account, set this optional parameter to http to return video by HTTP, rather than streaming. For Apple HTTP Live Streaming videos, set this optional parameter to http_ios to return the HTTP URL of the master index file as the videoFullLength parameter. For more information, see Delivering Videos with Apple HTTP Live Streaming.
 
output:OutputTypeEnum (default = null) — The default output is JSON, but you can get the output in XML, using RSS or MRSS. Use the output argument with the read methods to specify the format of the output. Valid values of the output argument are: json (the default), mrss (RSS with Media RSS and Brightcove extensions), and tm (for distribution through TubeMogul OneLoad). See RSS Output from the Media API and Creating Feeds for TubeMogul OneLoad with the Media API for code examples.
 
isFiltered:Boolean (default = true) — If set to false, the 'unfiltered' version of this method will be called, it also returns videos that are unscheduled, inactive, or deleted
 
allVideoFields:Boolean (default = false) — If set to true, all available Video Fields will be included false otherwise
 
requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean (default = true) — If true (default), then execute this request, otherwise just return the request URL.

Returns
String — The request URL to the Brightcove Media APIs
findVideosByCampaignId()method 
public function findVideosByCampaignId(campaignId:Number, pageSize:Number = 100, pageNumber:Number = 0, getItemCount:Boolean = false, videoFields:Array = null, customFields:Array = null, mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum = null, output:OutputTypeEnum = null, allVideoFields:Boolean = false, requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean = true):String

Gets all the videos associated with the given campaign ID. Campaigns are a feature of the consumer-generated media (CGM) module.

Parameters
campaignId:Number — The ID of the campaign you'd like to fetch videos for.
 
pageSize:Number (default = 100) — Number of items returned per page.
 
pageNumber:Number (default = 0) — The zero-indexed number of the page to return.
 
getItemCount:Boolean (default = false) — If true, also return how many total results there are.
 
videoFields:Array (default = null) — A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publishedDate , lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.
 
customFields:Array (default = null) — A comma-separated list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value customFields in the video_fields parameter.
 
mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum (default = null) — This is a MediaDeliveryTypeEnum with a value of http, http_ios or default. It is meaningful only if used together with the video_fields=FLVURL, videoFullLength, or renditions parameters. If universal delivery service is enabled for your account, set this optional parameter to http to return video by HTTP, rather than streaming. For Apple HTTP Live Streaming videos, set this optional parameter to http_ios to return the HTTP URL of the master index file as the videoFullLength parameter. For more information, see Delivering Videos with Apple HTTP Live Streaming.
 
output:OutputTypeEnum (default = null) — The default output is JSON, but you can get the output in XML, using RSS or MRSS. Use the output argument with the read methods to specify the format of the output. Valid values of the output argument are: json (the default), mrss (RSS with Media RSS and Brightcove extensions), and tm (for distribution through TubeMogul OneLoad). See RSS Output from the Media API and Creating Feeds for TubeMogul OneLoad with the Media API for code examples.

requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean (default = true) — If true (default), then execute this request, otherwise just return the request URL.

Find multiple videos, given their IDs.

Parameters
videoIds:Array — A comma-separated list of video IDs for the videos we want to retrieve in

findVideosByReferenceIds()method 
public function findVideosByReferenceIds(referenceIds:Array, videoFields:Array = null, customFields:Array = null, mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum = null, output:OutputTypeEnum = null, isFiltered:Boolean = true, allVideoFields:Boolean = false, requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean = true):String

Find multiple videos based on their publisher-assigned reference IDs.

Parameters
referenceIds:Array — The list of reference IDs for the videos we'd like to retrieve. This value is limited to 150 characters. The value cannot contain commas to work around this issue, avoid using commas in reference_id values.
 
videoFields:Array (default = null) — A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publishedDate , lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.
 
customFields:Array (default = null) — A comma-separated list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value customFields in the video_fields parameter.
 
mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum (default = null) — This is a MediaDeliveryTypeEnum with a value of http, http_ios or default. It is meaningful only if used together with the video_fields=FLVURL, videoFullLength, or renditions parameters. If universal delivery service is enabled for your account, set this optional parameter to http to return video by HTTP, rather than streaming. For Apple HTTP Live Streaming videos, set this optional parameter to http_ios to return the HTTP URL of the master index file as the videoFullLength parameter. For more information, see Delivering Videos with Apple HTTP Live Streaming.
 
output:OutputTypeEnum (default = null) — The default output is JSON, but you can get the output in XML, using RSS or MRSS. Use the output argument with the read methods to specify the format of the output. Valid values of the output argument are: json (the default), mrss (RSS with Media RSS and Brightcove extensions), and tm (for distribution through TubeMogul OneLoad). See RSS Output from the Media API and Creating Feeds for TubeMogul OneLoad with the Media API for code examples.
 
isFiltered:Boolean (default = true) — If set to false, the 'unfiltered' version of this method will be called, it also returns videos that are unscheduled, inactive, or deleted
 
allVideoFields:Boolean (default = false) — If set to true, all available Video Fields will be included false otherwise
 
requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean (default = true) — If true (default), then execute this request, otherwise just return the request URL.

Returns
String — The request URL to the Brightcove Media APIs
findVideosByTags()method 
public function findVideosByTags(andTags:Array = null, orTags:Array = null, pageSize:Number = 100, pageNumber:Number = 0, getItemCount:Boolean = false, videoFields:Array = null, customFields:Array = null, mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum = null, output:OutputTypeEnum = null, allVideoFields:Boolean = false, requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean = true):String

Performs a search on all the tags of the videos in this account, and returns a collection of videos that contain the specified tags. Note that tags are not case-sensitive. This method does not provide parameters for sorting the result set. Consider using the search_videos method, which offers more flexible search and sorting options.

Parameters
andTags:Array (default = null) — Limit the results to those that contain all of these tags.
 
orTags:Array (default = null) — Limit the results to those that contain at least one of these tags.
 
pageSize:Number (default = 100) — Number of items returned per page.
 
pageNumber:Number (default = 0) — The zero-indexed number of the page to return.
 
getItemCount:Boolean (default = false) — If true, also return how many total results there are.
 
videoFields:Array (default = null) — A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publishedDate , lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.
 
customFields:Array (default = null) — A comma-separated list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value customFields in the video_fields parameter.
 
mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum (default = null) — This is a MediaDeliveryTypeEnum with a value of http, http_ios or default. It is meaningful only if used together with the video_fields=FLVURL, videoFullLength, or renditions parameters. If universal delivery service is enabled for your account, set this optional parameter to http to return video by HTTP, rather than streaming. For Apple HTTP Live Streaming videos, set this optional parameter to http_ios to return the HTTP URL of the master index file as the videoFullLength parameter. For more information, see Delivering Videos with Apple HTTP Live Streaming.
 
output:OutputTypeEnum (default = null) — The default output is JSON, but you can get the output in XML, using RSS or MRSS. Use the output argument with the read methods to specify the format of the output. Valid values of the output argument are: json (the default), mrss (RSS with Media RSS and Brightcove extensions), and tm (for distribution through TubeMogul OneLoad). See RSS Output from the Media API and Creating Feeds for TubeMogul OneLoad with the Media API for code examples.
 
allVideoFields:Boolean (default = false) — If set to true, all available Video Fields will be included false otherwise
 
requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean (default = true) — If true (default), then execute this request, otherwise just return the request URL.

Returns
String — The request URL to the Brightcove Media APIs
findVideosByText()method 
public function findVideosByText(text:String, pageSize:Number = 100, pageNumber:Number = 0, getItemCount:Boolean = false, videoFields:Array = null, customFields:Array = null, mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum = null, output:OutputTypeEnum = null, allVideoFields:Boolean = false, requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean = true):String

Searches through all the videos in this account, and returns a collection of videos whose name, short description, or long description contain a match for the specified text. Unlike some other Read methods, this method does not provide parameters for sorting the result set. The result set is sorted by relevance. Consider using the search_videos method, which offers more flexible search and sorting options. The find_videos_by_text method returns substring matches â words from your search string plus a wildcard ( at the end; thus, if your search string is "war", the result set will include results such as "warrior", "warfare", and "warbler." Substrings that don't match the beginning of a word are not returned; thus, if your search string is "war", the result set would not include results such as "swarthy" or "inward".

Parameters
text:String — The text we're searching for.
 
pageSize:Number (default = 100) — Number of items returned per page.
 
pageNumber:Number (default = 0) — The zero-indexed number of the page to return.
 
getItemCount:Boolean (default = false) — If true, also return how many total results there are.
 
videoFields:Array (default = null) — A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publishedDate , lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.
 
customFields:Array (default = null) — A comma-separated list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value customFields in the video_fields parameter.
 
mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum (default = null) — This is a MediaDeliveryTypeEnum with a value of http, http_ios or default. It is meaningful only if used together with the video_fields=FLVURL, videoFullLength, or renditions parameters. If universal delivery service is enabled for your account, set this optional parameter to http to return video by HTTP, rather than streaming. For Apple HTTP Live Streaming videos, set this optional parameter to http_ios to return the HTTP URL of the master index file as the videoFullLength parameter. For more information, see Delivering Videos with Apple HTTP Live Streaming.
 
output:OutputTypeEnum (default = null) — The default output is JSON, but you can get the output in XML, using RSS or MRSS. Use the output argument with the read methods to specify the format of the output. Valid values of the output argument are: json (the default), mrss (RSS with Media RSS and Brightcove extensions), and tm (for distribution through TubeMogul OneLoad). See RSS Output from the Media API and Creating Feeds for TubeMogul OneLoad with the Media API for code examples.
 
allVideoFields:Boolean (default = false) — If set to true, all available Video Fields will be included false otherwise
 
requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean (default = true) — If true (default), then execute this request, otherwise just return the request URL.

Returns
String — The request URL to the Brightcove Media APIs
findVideosByUserId()method 
public function findVideosByUserId(userId:Number, pageSize:Number = 100, pageNumber:Number = 0, getItemCount:Boolean = false, videoFields:Array = null, customFields:Array = null, mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum = null, output:OutputTypeEnum = null, allVideoFields:Boolean = false, requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean = true):String

Retrieves the videos uploaded by the specified user id. This method can be used to find videos submitted using the consumer-generated media (CGM) module.

Parameters
userId:Number — The ID of the user whose videos we'd like to retrieve.
 
pageSize:Number (default = 100) — Number of items returned per page.
 
pageNumber:Number (default = 0) — The zero-indexed number of the page to return.
 
getItemCount:Boolean (default = false) — If true, also return how many total results there are.
 
videoFields:Array (default = null) — A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publishedDate , lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.
 
customFields:Array (default = null) — A comma-separated list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value customFields in the video_fields parameter.
 
mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum (default = null) — This is a MediaDeliveryTypeEnum with a value of http, http_ios or default. It is meaningful only if used together with the video_fields=FLVURL, videoFullLength, or renditions parameters. If universal delivery service is enabled for your account, set this optional parameter to http to return video by HTTP, rather than streaming. For Apple HTTP Live Streaming videos, set this optional parameter to http_ios to return the HTTP URL of the master index file as the videoFullLength parameter. For more information, see Delivering Videos with Apple HTTP Live Streaming.
 
output:OutputTypeEnum (default = null) — The default output is JSON, but you can get the output in XML, using RSS or MRSS. Use the output argument with the read methods to specify the format of the output. Valid values of the output argument are: json (the default), mrss (RSS with Media RSS and Brightcove extensions), and tm (for distribution through TubeMogul OneLoad). See RSS Output from the Media API and Creating Feeds for TubeMogul OneLoad with the Media API for code examples.
 
allVideoFields:Boolean (default = false) — If set to true, all available Video Fields will be included false otherwise
 
requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean (default = true) — If true (default), then execute this request, otherwise just return the request URL.

searchVideos()method 
public function searchVideos(all:Array = null, any:Array = null, none:Array = null, sortBy:SortByTypeEnum = null, exact:Boolean = false, pageSize:Number = 100, pageNumber:Number = 0, getItemCount:Boolean = false, videoFields:Array = null, customFields:Array = null, mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum = null, output:OutputTypeEnum = null, allVideoFields:Boolean = false, requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean = true):String

Searches videos according to the criteria provided by the user. The criteria are constructed using field/value pairs specified in the command. Consider using the search_videos method for video searches rather than using the other find_video read methods. The search_videos method offers more flexible search and sorting options than the find_video methods, and is especially more flexible than the find_videos_by_text and find_videos_by_tags methods. For more examples of the search_videos method, see: Searching for Videos with the Media API.

Parameters
all:Array (default = null) — Specifies the field:value pairs for search criteria that MUST be present in the index in order to return a hit in the result set. The format is fieldName:value. If the field's name is not present, it is assumed to be displayName, shortDescription, and longDescription.
 
any:Array (default = null) — Specifies the field:value pairs for search criteria AT LEAST ONE of which must be present to return a hit in the result set. The format is fieldName:value. If the field's name is not present, it is assumed to be displayName, shortDescription, and longDescription.
 
none:Array (default = null) — Specifies the field:value pairs for search criteria that MUST NOT be present to return a hit in the result set. The format is fieldName:value. If the field's name is not present, it is assumed to be displayName, shortDescription, and longDescription.
 
sortBy:SortByTypeEnum (default = null) — The field by which to sort the results. A SortByType: One of PUBLISH_DATE, CREATION_DATE, MODIFIED_DATE, PLAYS_TOTAL, PLAYS_TRAILING_WEEK.
 
exact:Boolean (default = false) — If true, disables fuzzy search and requires an exact match of search terms. A fuzzy search does not require an exact match of the indexed terms, but will return a hit for terms that are closely related based on language-specific criteria. The fuzzy search is available only if your account is based in the United States.
 
pageSize:Number (default = 100) — Number of items returned per page.
 
pageNumber:Number (default = 0) — The zero-indexed number of the page to return.
 
getItemCount:Boolean (default = false) — If true, also return how many total results there are.
 
videoFields:Array (default = null) — A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the Videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the video: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publishedDate , lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.
 
customFields:Array (default = null) — A comma-separated list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value customFields in the video_fields parameter.
 
mediaDelivery:MediaDeliveryTypeEnum (default = null) — This is a MediaDeliveryTypeEnum with a value of http, http_ios or default. It is meaningful only if used together with the video_fields=FLVURL, videoFullLength, or renditions parameters. If universal delivery service is enabled for your account, set this optional parameter to http to return video by HTTP, rather than streaming. For Apple HTTP Live Streaming videos, set this optional parameter to http_ios to return the HTTP URL of the master index file as the videoFullLength parameter. For more information, see Delivering Videos with Apple HTTP Live Streaming.
 
output:OutputTypeEnum (default = null) — The default output is JSON, but you can get the output in XML, using RSS or MRSS. Use the output argument with the read methods to specify the format of the output. Valid values of the output argument are: json (the default), mrss (RSS with Media RSS and Brightcove extensions), and tm (for distribution through TubeMogul OneLoad). See RSS Output from the Media API and Creating Feeds for TubeMogul OneLoad with the Media API for code examples.
 
allVideoFields:Boolean (default = false) — If set to true, all available Video Fields will be included false otherwise
 
requestShouldBeExecuted:Boolean (default = true) — If true (default), then execute this request, otherwise just return the request URL.

Returns
String — The request URL to the Brightcove Media APIs
Constant detail

public static const API_URL:String = "http://api.brightcove.com/services/library"

The URL for the media API

FAULT_NAMEconstant 
public static const FAULT_NAME:String = "MEDIA_REQUEST_FAULT"

The name of the event dispatch when the media request has been executed and a fault has been processed

public static const RESULT_NAME:String = "MEDIA_REQUEST_RESULT"

The name of the event dispatch when the media request has been executed and a result has been populated
